pageContext.claim: “And we actually did very well in '18 also. We won the Senate. We got extra seats in the Senate. We had a lot of victories: Ohio and Georgia and Florida and Oklahoma. And lots of states and the governorships. And I went out and campaigned a lot, and we had a very, very high record of success wherever we went.”
pageContext.analysis: Democrats gained 7 governorships (Republicans lost 6), along with 40 House seats in the 2018 midterm elections. 23 of the 36 candidates Trump campaigned for won their race, according to an analysis from the Brookings Institute, which equals about a 64 percent success rate.
